result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro Perez-Juarez

records.addlTxt: Defendant accepted into FOP; contract terminates on October 20, 2023

Court reporter Paige Reardon.  Defendant Alejandro Perez-Juarez in court.  Attorney Colleen J. Martine in court for Alejandro Perez-Juarez.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Perez-Juarez had requested an interpreter but now states he does not need one, Court interpreter Fayme Filipiak is on stand by for interpretation purposes. Court interpreter is duly sworn. Chapter 950 Compliant. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1. Count 2 is dismissed. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.

Parties have reached an agreement for DPU. DE given notice in hand for next hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
DE has been approved by SPD. DE given notice in hand for next hearing.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Paid interpreter fees for services on 4/18/22 to Fred Svensson, batch 5318.
from the Court to the defendant RE how to obtain an appointed attorney.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Sergio C-P and Leticia P-M.
  - Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
  Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.
  Trial Judge - Br 17

08:53 AM Defendant appeared.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Fred Svensson duly sworn and interpreted. Victim appeared and made statement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
